snippet: Compared with the economies of other industrialized countries, the United States economy has done rather well since the depths of 2008. Only the Canadian economy has done better.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column compares the recovery of the United States economy since the 2008 fiscal crisis against the euro zone and Group of 7 nations, arguing that it has largely outperformed most other countries; notes that the economy, adjusted for inflation, was 1.2 percent larger in the first quarter of 2012 than it was in the peak quarter before the recession.
lead_paragraph: Compared with the economies of other industrialized countries, the United States economy has done rather well since the depths of 2008. Only the Canadian economy has done better.

headline.print_headline: A Slow Recovery in the United States, but It’s All Relative
headline.seo: A Slow Recovery, but It’s All Relative
headline.main: A Slow Recovery in the United States, but It’s All Relative
